alert.note: Alert for Cabell; Kanawha; Lincoln; Putnam (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 25 at 1:44PM EDT until August 25 at 3:15PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTHEASTERN CABELL, WESTERN KANAWHA, NORTHEASTERN LINCOLN AND SOUTHWESTERN PUTNAM COUNTIES... At 144 PM EDT, The thunderstorms responsible for the heavy rains have since moved south of the warned area. However, runoff will continue to result in flash flooding of small creeks and streams. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... St. Albans, Hurricane, Tornado, Alum Creek and Culloden. This includes the following streams and drainages... Hurricane Creek, Browns Creek, Rockhouse Branch, Trace Fork, Sycamore Creek, Turkey Creek, and Laurel Fork. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
